cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Creeping west-northwest then west-southwest toward the southern North Carolina coast and northeastern South Carolina, then expected to meander slowly inland across South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear/southern North Carolina coast (close to Wilmington, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch area south of Wilmington)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC northward to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina coastline, especially Cape Fear to Cape Lookout
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible at the port with sustained winds near 100 mph and higher gusts as the eye moves ashore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Forecast surge 7–11 ft possible from Cape Fear to Cape Lookout, including the Cape Fear River near Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: 20–30 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, likely causing catastrophic flash and river flooding around Wilmington.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged power outages, and flooding of access roads to terminal facilities.
